channel.title: R on Personal Website
channel.description: Recent content in R on Personal Website

item.title: Survey of water suppliers in Brazil
item.description: Purpose of the study The survey is part of a larger effort to collect original data in preparation of the publication ‚ÄúDevelopment in America‚Äù 2020 that will focus on Infrastructure (Energy, Water and Transportation) sector in LAC. Creators This page was created by Luisa M. Mimmi (Research Fellow - consultant at IADB) but builds on data collected by various IADB colleagues and partner organizations. Acknowledgements This survey is sponsored by the Interamerican Development Bank (IADB), Water Division, Knowledge Team WSA Knowledge, where I work as a consultant.

item.title: Analysis of Green Card processing time
item.description: This short project investigates whether the Trump administration has slowed down the labor certification & green card application process for foreign workers. The analysis relies on DOL/OFLC and USCIS open data. Results Short Article Code on Github

item.title: LinkdIn Data: competitivity of cities
item.description: This mini-study project was a take-home test I completed in winter 2018 as part of a job interview for a consultancy with IFC (in collaboration with LinkedIn). I used it as an opportunity to refresh some R programming and learn to use the xaringan package to make html presentations. Results Slides (xaringan) Code on Github

item.title: World Development Indicator: life expectancy analysis
item.description: This mini-study project was an exercise to learn how to use the World Bank‚Äôs API for the World Development Indicator (WDI) repository. In this study, I explore the indicator Life expectancy at birth and I also do some comparative analisys using other indicators that I expect to be highly correlated with life expectancy: namely GDP and the status of Fragile and conflict affected situations (FCS). In order to flag the individual countries that are classified as FCS, I used the World Bank list of economies (as of June 2017) found here

item.title: Links to useful R resources
item.description: Here are some useful links and resources for R programming. General Rstudio Community: forum and discussions organized by macro-topic. Rseek: a sort of wiki R page! From rstudioconf2019: a collection of R resources by @littlemissdata Cheatsheets: self-explanatory WTF.. or “What They Forgot to Teach You About R” üòâ Another life-changing guide from Jenny Bryan Google’s R Style Guide Project Management Best Practices Handling Packages R-Bloggers blog (scroll to) reference: collection of links… analytical work reproducibly using R: Pre-print article Karl Broman slides Joris Muller’s Blog on The “ten simple rules for reproducible computational research” in R Joris Muller’s Blog on A basic reproducible data analysis workflow - principles R studio TERMINAL Great post Using rstudio-terminal/ More on Using the RStudio Terminal DATABASES Databases using R RStudio list API & R Amanda Gadrow Resources Saving tokens Various Ways Saving tokens WTF… to tell you ggplot2 & GRAPHS Great line by line tutorial ggplot flipbook Modern Dive Chapter Grammar of Graphics Table Packages to discover DataExplorer EDA, See github Formattable Tables, See more info table1 Tables, See more info ggstatsplot Graphs, See more info Extension of ggplot2 package for creating graphics with details from statistical tests included in the plots themselves and targeted primarily at behavioral sciences community.
